svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Children who experience violent discipline, boys vs girls
Percentage of boys and girls 2–14 years old who, according to self-reports by caregivers or other household
members, experienced any violent discipline at home in the past month (including psychological aggression and/or
physical punishment). In some instances observations refer to only part of a country. See sources for more details.
Percentage of boys (2–14) who experience any violent discipline (UNICEF Global Databases (2016))
Percentage of girls (2–14) who experience any violent discipline
Source: Violent Discipline - UNICEF Global Databases (2016)
